excerpts: The only thing that didn't go over well was the Horchata.
Our 4 year old loves them (for the usual high sugar content), haha.
horchata.author: Zoran L.
horchata.review:
Chilitos Rellenos ($4.95) - Three small peppers stuffed with meat and covered with sauce.

Tamales de Carne de Pollo ($3.95) - Tamale with chicken, olives, red bell peppers, prunes with special sauce inside all wrapped in banana leaves

Camarones al Mojo De Ajo ($12.95) - Prawns in garlic sauce

Plato de San Miguel ($13.95) - Thin New York steak, sausage, fried plantain and fresh cheese

Pollo Frito ($11.95) - Fried Chicken

Entrees are served with rice, black beans, beet salad, and tortillas.

Overall the food was delicious.  As a family we shared everything, and our daughter happily devoured the tamale and fried chicken.  

Great family run restaurant. Service was fast and very friendly. 

The only thing that didn't go over well was the Horchata.  Our 4 year old loves them (for the usual high sugar content), haha.  This one wasn't very sweet, so depends on your tastebuds.

We look forward to coming back and trying other Guatemalan dishes.

They are currently CASH ONLY with plans to accept credit cards in the coming weeks.

excerpts: They were delicious, plus el agua de horchata was the best, its on the sweet side
but i love sweet
so I loved it.
When we were almost ready to leave the sweet little girl brought us fruit which where on the house.
Overall, i had an amazing experience at this place, it made me feel at home, everyone was super nice and welcoming.
The food was delicious and costumer service was excellent!
horchata.author: Laura S.
horchata.review: We stopped here thinking it was a Mexican Restaurant because it said mayan kitchen, for some reason we thought it was Mexican, it was a surprise to know it was a Guatemalan Restaurant. My first impression was "wow, is so clean and well organized for such a small place" its cleaner that most of the restaurants plus the costumer service is excellent, I don't recall going to another restaurant and being serve like i did there. the owners kids are so well educated and know how to serve. there was a little girl who would come every few minutes to check if we needed anything else and she was so polite and well spoken for her age. due to the fact that i don't know anything about the Guatemala cuisine, It took me a while to choose what to eat. initially, i wanted the enchiladas but one of the waitress told me that the enchiladas were not the typical enchiladas but a tostada. she educate me on every dish, and at the end i decided to get the tamales. There were three tamales with a side of beans and cream. They were delicious, plus el agua de horchata was the best, its on the sweet side but i love sweet so I loved it. When we were almost ready to leave the sweet little girl brought us fruit which where on the house. Overall, i had an amazing experience at this place, it made me feel at home, everyone was super nice and welcoming. The food was delicious and costumer service was excellent!

excerpts: Ordered horchata and famosa beer.
horchata.author: Annie D.
horchata.review:
Came to this place at around noon hoping for a great experience and i did! I loved it! The smell of the restaurant was like the smell from home. It didn't smell like grease like other restaurants. 
I was confused when i walked in because i wasn't sure whether to wait to be seated or just pick a spot. 

Anyway, the lady who served my table (1 other person with me) was very nice. She did everything, took our order, drinks, and bussed our table. 

We ordered tostadas which were delicious. 6 total, 2 guacamole, 2 beans, 2 salsa topped with onions and spicy salsa on the side. 

We ordered plato san miguel which is number 30. I highly recommend this plate because it wasnt overwhelming and still filled me up. 
Ordered horchata and famosa beer. 

Everything was nice and clean. Definitely coming back~

excerpts: Wash it down with their house-made cinnamonny horchata goodness.
Yum.
horchata.author: vanessa J.
horchata.review:
Wow. I'm coming back here as soon as possible. I could not stop eating my food and now I'm in a food coma. Forgive my lack of eloquence. 
I really enjoyed the longanizas (spicy sausage) as well as the steak in the Plato San Miguel. The platanos were perfectly cooked and you'd be a fool not to try the habanero salsa. Wash it down with their house-made cinnamonny horchata goodness. Yum.

excerpts: First, the good: the tortillas were great, the horchata was pretty tasty, I liked the black beans, and the service was excellent.
horchata.author: Lisa K.
horchata.review: I guess I ordered the wrong things here. First, the good: the tortillas were great, the horchata was pretty tasty, I liked the black beans, and the service was excellent. I got the vegetarian plate, which was mainly just bland, from the baked plantain to the rice to the plain, boiled vegetables. I wouldn't get it again. The pepian chicken had a tasty sauce but the chicken seemed to be full of gristle and odds and ends, and had a kinda of odd, chewy texture. I wouldn't be too encouraged to get any of the other chicken dishes from this, especially since I didn't find the menu to be very descriptive. But, I might give the beef dishes a try based on other reviews.

excerpts:
+ Plato San Miguel
+ Carne Encebollada
+ Horchata

Other than what I listed above, you have to try the Camarones al Mojo de Ajo (Shrimp w/ garlic butter sauce).

taquitos.review:
Review for Antojtos San Miguel food truck using San Miguel address.

locale: soma street park (3/21)

menu: rellenos, tamales (4) , tacos (4), taquitos, fried chicken (8),  (quantamalean eats) plates,  etc.

eats: tamale, chicken (4)
-big tamale with smooth masa (lard), semidry breast meat  within

-deliz (must be the lard)

crumbs:
-most food items seem premade, not made on truck
-fast, friendly service.
-food not cheap, between reasonable and pricey.
another review mentions fried chicken only 1 piece for $8?

excerpts: We also ordered tostadas and taquitos.
taquitos.author: Alex A.
taquitos.review:
Took my mother out to dinner last Saturday and let me tell you we were both in a coma.

We first order Horchatas for both of us. They were absolutely delicious. We also ordered tostadas and taquitos. I think these are my favorite appetizers. 

We decided to share the Pollo en Crema and it was  a great idea as the portions were huge. I wish they would be a little more attentive but other than that great place for a small pop family restaurant.

excerpts: We ordered the taquitos - which were the best thing we ordered.
we also got a stuffed pepper appetizer which was fair.
Then we ordered 2 tamales which my bf thought were okay
taquitos.author: Amy W.
taquitos.review:
This place - I wanted to love it - service was great - but it was just weird.

We ordered a LARGE beer and it came in a bamboo glass - which might have been kinda cool - but the glass smelled funny and I'm not so certain you can clean bamboo like you can glass so it kinda grossed me out.

We ordered the taquitos - which were the best thing we ordered.  we also got a stuffed pepper appetizer which was fair.  Then we ordered 2 tamales which my bf thought were okay I thought they were gross, kinda slimy masa and flavorless to boot.  

Entree we spilt a plate with beef, a house-made sausage, rice, plantains, a small wedge of cojita, a log of beans that actually looked EXACTLY like a big dog poop (sorry but its true, once i said it, neither if us could look at it, let alone eat it AND some spaghetti thing on top (HUH? spaghetti??).  Served with some small not-homemade corn tortillas.

Sorry, this place just missed the mark for me, I guess I can see how people could like it, I just didn't.

Oh we had a Scoutmob and paid $40 with tip (which included a $15 discount)

excerpts: I personally love the New York steak (great flavors and served with beans, rice, and pasta), the seafood soup, the taquitos, and the shrimp appetizer (tostaditos de cerviche).
All these dishes are very fresh.
My husband
taquitos.author: L L.
taquitos.review:
This is a great little place if you are looking for some authentic Guatemalan food.  I think you have to know what dishes to pick, though.  I personally love the New York steak (great flavors and served with beans, rice, and pasta), the seafood soup, the taquitos, and the shrimp appetizer (tostaditos de cerviche).  All these dishes are very fresh.  My husband and I end up ordering these pretty much every time.  

Because of the quality of food and authentic flavors, I will give this place 5 stars.  The downside is that it's cash only, which can be quite a pain for dinner.

excerpts: I love their black beans, taquitos, and their guacamole is to die for.
For entrees, I love the grilled chicken (not sure what it is called) and garlic shrimp with steak.
taquitos.author: Milly H.
taquitos.review:
The restaurant gives you a very comfortable feeling when you walk in. The walls and ceiling are decorated with little pieces of Guatemalan trinkets and art. I had (and still have) so much fun staring at the unique pieces.

The food is delicious. I love their black beans, taquitos, and their guacamole is to die for. For entrees, I love the grilled chicken (not sure what it is called) and garlic shrimp with steak. OMG, talking about it makes me wanna go there and eat right now. 

The family that owns this place make you feel like you are part of the family when you're there. Great customer service. 

Don't forget to order their fresh made smoothies (almost taste like dessert in a cup!) Their coffee is a good way to wind down their dinner. Every time I go, I leave stuffed. 

Prices are very reasonable for what they give you. Tons of authentic Guatemalan food!

Anytime I'm in the area, I head down to San Miguel.

excerpts: I had the plato san miguel and taquitos and tostada sides, brought me back to the old days!
taquitos.author: R. V.
taquitos.review:
Awesome Guatemalan food. At last I found what I was looking for, and they did not disappoint. Service was the best, extremely friendly staff, made us feel like we were at a friend's house eating a homemade meal :)

I had the plato san miguel and taquitos and tostada sides, brought me back to the old days! couldn't be more satisfied.

Can't wait to come back to try their breakfast!

excerpts: The taquitos are just like the ones the Indigenas make.
It is just like being transported back to guatemala.
For those who have not had Guatemalan food don't expect it to be like Mexican food.
I hope everyone who eats there goes with an open mind.
It is a wonderful surprise.
taquitos.author: Elvy C.
taquitos.review: I am a Guatemalan American and have grown up eating this food. This food is as good as eating it in Guatemala. The tostadas are just like the ones you can get at a mercado. The taquitos are just like the ones the Indigenas make. It is just like being transported back to guatemala. For those who have not had Guatemalan food don't expect it to be like Mexican food. I hope everyone who eats there goes with an open mind. It is a wonderful surprise.

excerpts: We got the Guatemalan Salad, the Sabor Sampler and the plantanos and everything was incredible.
With 2 glasses of wine, the bill was less than $50, which this working mama greatly appreciates.
Lastly, the service was fantastic.
Our server, the daughter of the owners was incredibly warm and told us the history of the  restaurant.
I recommended it to my dad and he took a friend yesterday and they both loved it.
Go to Sabor de San Miguel!
You will not be disappointed!

I recommended it to my dad and he took a friend yesterday and they both loved it.  Go to Sabor de San Miguel! You will not be disappointed!

excerpts: I don't think I saw 'pollo en jocon', 'saq-ik', 'caldo de gallina', 'salpicon de panza', and such things.
It would also be great if they had thick, handmade corn tortillas, but these hardly appear anywhere I go
so I cannot hold it against them.
caldo de gallina.author: Osberto M.
caldo de gallina.review:
I've eaten here a few times within the last two months.  I was born and raised in Guatemala, and have had these dishes all my life both at home and outside.

In my opinion, the 'caldo de res' (a simple but really tasty beef stock with beef chunks and vegetables in it) is 5 stars, and the 'caq-ik'  (Q'eqchi language name for the dish) is worth 3 1/2. I am not used to having the caq-ik broth be this thick.  As far as I am concerned caq-ik is meant to be just like caldo de res in terms of consistency, but perhaps this varies. Either way, I think I remember a more intense flavor. 

Rellenitos de platano (mashed plantain paste filled with fried beans and then itself fried) were awesome and unhealthy as expected. 

Their menu could be richer. I don't think I saw 'pollo en jocon', 'saq-ik', 'caldo de gallina', 'salpicon de panza', and such things. It would also be great if they had thick, handmade corn tortillas, but these hardly appear anywhere I go so I cannot hold it against them. It would be also nice if besides rellenitos de platano they also offered simply sliced fried plantain with fried beans on the side as well, or fried banana. All of it may seem redundant but they are good in their own special ways.

Service is friendly but slow, they will take time to bring the beer (they have some of the Guatemalan beers there, for the curious), the food and the bill.  They do check on you to see if you are missing tortillas for your meal, and they also offer a couple of courtesy melon slices some times.

Finally, the thing that really goes against them is the aspect of the place. Poorly lit, smells like fish (hopefully from the fish dishes they serve), somewhat shabby. They could improve a lot on this and that would get them 4 starts. Don't be misled, the fishy smell at the entrance has very little relation to how good the caldo de res is.  Plus, they have some very folksy Guatemalan music playing complete with videos of the bands, so you get to see that too.

mojarra frita.author: Mari S.
mojarra frita.review:
San Miguel is a family owned Guatemalan restaurant located on Mission St. in the neighborhood bordering the Outer Mission and Bernal Heights.

It has been awhile, so this review is a bit overdue. Dined on a Sunday evening and ordered the following...

- CHUCHITOS (Small corn tamale with chicken inside)

- CAMARONES ASADOS (Charbroiled Prawns with "Chimichurri" sauce)

- MOJARRA FRITA (Fresh fried Tilapia fish)

- CAK-ICK (Authentic special chicken soup)

- PLATO DE SAN MIGUEL (New york steak, pork sausage, Guatemalan style fried plantain and fresh cheese)

- RELLENITOS DE PLATANO (Mashes banana plantain with black beans inside)

- PLATANOS EN MOLE (Banana plantain with special sweet brown (chocolate) sauce)

I very much enjoyed my meal, the ambiance, and homey feeling this restaurant conveys. Would definitely come back and highly recommend for Guatemalan food in the city.

excerpts: I love Guatemalan food and after many trips there, and most recently 10 weeks there, I was craving some pepian.
Was it the best pepian I've had?
No.
But it was decent.
And it's the closest
I'll come
, I'm sure, to having the pepian of my dreams while in SF.
The prices are good and the menu is robust.
pepian.author: David B.
pepian.review:
When you walk into San Miguel, it feels like you're in a tipico restaurante in Antigua, or the villages nearby. That's a plus. The authentic textiles, the music or TV playing, and the posters on the wall. I wanted to feel like I was back in Guate and I did. 

I love Guatemalan food and after many trips there, and most recently 10 weeks there, I was craving some pepian. Was it the best pepian I've had? No. But it was decent. And it's the closest I'll come, I'm sure, to having the pepian of my dreams while in SF. The prices are good and the menu is robust. I have a feeling I'll be trying their hilachas next. 

My only request for more authenticity would be the tortillas. The flat, Mexican-style (American style?) corn tortillas were something I'd completely forgotten about. I'd love to eat my meal with the fat, smaller ones I'm used to (spoiled by) when I'm in Guatemala. These just didn't do the trick for me.

Overall, go there, eat well, and enjoy!

excerpts: Man just finished lunch and the Pepian, which is a Guatemalan dish was BOMB.
I lived in Guate for some years and the flavor brought me right back!
If u like flavors and feel like some authentic food, give this a go!

http://youtu.be/47bFAmk5-Bo

Disappointing things by culinary Miguel: Traditional Guatemalan pepian.
pepian.author: Jason B.
pepian.review:
Those things.

Good things by musical Miguel: http://youtu.be/47bFAmk5-Bo

Disappointing things by culinary Miguel: Traditional Guatemalan pepian.

Homemade seed sauce gave this chicken and vegetable stew a unique flavor. Slightly sweet. Slightly spicy. Lighter than mole. Different.

Where they lost me (and the third start) was the menu. Inside and online it claims two pieces of chicken. Only got one. Was told that's how it comes now.

All fine and good but you need to update your menu.

Might be more forgiving had it been the greatest thing ever. But it wasn't. And not very filling unless you want to eat all 10 small tortillas that come on the side.

Fortunately had another Guatemalan tradition to start. French roll with black beans was good and kept me full despite the underwhelming main.

Service was nice and the space was very Latin America inspired. With an average rating of four stars might have just gone on an off day.

Either way I don't plan on coming back for more things.

excerpts: The best pepian I ever tried the food
it's amazing great flavor !!!!
pepian.author: Yvonne W.
pepian.review: I love this place ... The best pepian I ever tried the food it's amazing great flavor !!!!

excerpts: the Pepian wasn't nearly as good as Juanita's, but it was an admirable second.
The "tortillera" had left and we really missed having homemade corn tortillas.
We will definitely return!
pepian.author: Ginger H.
pepian.review: Muy autenico!! It was great to find yummy Guatemalan food so close by.  Attentive and friendly service and good food.... the Pepian wasn't nearly as good as Juanita's, but it was an admirable second.  The "tortillera" had left and we really missed having homemade corn tortillas.  We will definitely return!

excerpts: Got the pepian, two pieces of chicken (not one, unlike Jason B's review) with seed sauce, cilantro and veggies.
Not sure what the seeds were made of but this was served in a shallow bowl, stew consistency, and sufficiently delicious that I used the tortillas to get as much of the sauce as I could.
(The sauce goes well on a tortilla with the salsa, by the way.
The salsa is, as warned by the waiter, extremely spicy so a microscopic amount goes a long way.)
pepian.author: Charles B.
pepian.review:
Surprised this place only has 62 reviews. For a hole in the wall, this place has some sophisticated flavors. I don't mean the food is stuffy-it's exactly the opposite. But someone really thought about the flavors and took care to make them interesting and sometimes unusual.

Got the pepian, two pieces of chicken (not one, unlike Jason B's review) with seed sauce, cilantro and veggies. Not sure what the seeds were made of but this was served in a shallow bowl, stew consistency, and sufficiently delicious that I used the tortillas to get as much of the sauce as I could. (The sauce goes well on a tortilla with the salsa, by the way. The salsa is, as warned by the waiter, extremely spicy so a microscopic amount goes a long way.) This is pure comfort food.

The hot chocolate had an unusual taste, although an agreeable, slightly fruity, one. A sprig of something showed up on the spoon. I asked the waiter, who explained that they make their hot chocolate with cinnamon and (I forget the name of the herb but it begins with a 'c' or 's' and wasn't cilantro).

For a place with so many items on the menu, they only have three desserts, all based on plantains. Two involve frying, so I decided to try the third, plantains in mole. I got the description from the waiter, who told me the mole was slightly spicy. If I had ordered from the menu, where it says the mole sauce is sweet, I would have been shocked with what I got. As it was, I found the dessert an acquired taste that I was part way to acquiring. The sauce was excellent, chocolaty and assertively spicy with sesame seeds on top, and I could taste the sweetness of the plantains through the spiciness of the mole. I would say that if you are adventurous, like spicy food, and are looking for a barely-sweet dessert, definitely try this. Still, be warned that the spiciness outweighs the sweetness.

Service is friendly with no language barrier. The waiter (waiter-chef? he was also doing stuff in the kitchen) is happy to describe the dishes and came by to check my tortilla basket and again to see if I needed anything.

TV was playing Latino music videos (marimba bands and similar) at a reasonable volume.

Fascinating wall display of photos and paintings of Guatemala. A couple plants for greenery (although one of the fronds need to be trimmed so it doesn't brush the customers' head).

Clean.

One vegetarian option, the Plato Vegetariano, which doesn't seem to be shown on their website. Haven't tried it yet.

Check it out.

excerpts:
Chicken Pepian
Boneless pieces of chicken were immersed in an intoxicating earthy broth made from chilies, tomatillos, and seeds.
pepian.author: Rob L.
pepian.review:
AN OASIS IN THE MISSION DISTRICT SERVING AUTHENTIC GUATAMALAN FOOD

We opened the sliding door and entered this cozy and cute restaurant on a cold and rainy evening.  Plants and wooden carvings hanging from the tin-roof ceiling add atmosphere to the dining room.  The friendly server came over to greet us and took our order in Spanish.  She brought us sliced pineapple and watermelon to begin the meal.

Chicken Pepian
Boneless pieces of chicken were immersed in an intoxicating earthy broth made from chilies, tomatillos, and seeds.  Rice and homemade corn tortillas were served on the side.  This dish exceeded my expectations!

Chicken Mole
L ordered the chicken in mole which was served with rice, beans, and beets.  He was very pleased with the dish.  I tasted the mole and it was on the sweet side but tasted very good.

The salsa served on the side is spicy and flavorful.  We were very pleased with the attentive service; it was like having a homemade meal.

excerpts: My buddy got the Pepian which had a bit more depth.
Nothing spectacular, but homey plates for decent prices.
pepian.author: Anthony R.
pepian.review: Wanted to like this cozy little Guatemalan spot more than I actually did. The hulaches (shredded beef in a tomato sauce) tasted a bit watered down and flat. My buddy got the Pepian which had a bit more depth. Nothing spectacular, but homey plates for decent prices.

excerpts: I'm from Guatemala and grew up with my mom making stuff like Pepian, rabo (oxtail), tamales, sopa de res, hilachas etc.
So I really want to like this place.
The service is good, very attentive.
But the food can be hit or miss.
The first time I came here, I came with a friend and we tried the ceviche.
It tasted nice and fresh, it was pretty good.
Also had the Pepian, the sauce for it was good
but I was disappointed that they made it with chicken.
The second time I came it was with my parents.
They ordered the sopa de res and were pretty happy with it and they have discerning taste for that sort of thing.
I decided to try the mole and it wasn't very good
I'm sorry to report.
I'm not sure if mole is supposed to be so chocolaty...
the chicken was sort of bland and chewy.
I would definitely recommend the Pepian, and will try the sopa de res.
pepian.author: Jose U.
pepian.review:
I'm from Guatemala and grew up with my mom making stuff like Pepian, rabo (oxtail), tamales, sopa de res, hilachas etc. So I really want to like this place. The service is good, very attentive. But the food can be hit or miss. The first time I came here, I came with a friend and we tried the ceviche. It tasted nice and fresh, it was pretty good. Also had the Pepian, the sauce for it was good but I was disappointed that they made it with chicken.
The second time I came it was with my parents. They ordered the sopa de res and were pretty happy with it and they have discerning taste for that sort of thing. I decided to try the mole and it wasn't very good I'm sorry to report. I'm not sure if mole is supposed to be so chocolaty...the chicken was sort of bland and chewy. Also the whole plate was sort of a mess I thought because the chicken mole was served with black beans rice and queso. It was just all over the place in terms of flavors.

 My dad ordered platanos en mole and there the chocolaty sauce complemented the plantains very well.

I would definitely recommend the Pepian, and will try the sopa de res. Unfortunately they don't make rabo :(

The place looks clean, but it's kind of small and to add to the ambiance they play marimba music and videos of Guatemalan music. The place is definitely not good for large groups or even medium ones, four people per group tops. Parking is tough in the neighborhood and it's CASH ONLY :(

excerpts: The pepian chicken had a tasty sauce but the chicken seemed to be full of gristle and odds and ends, and had a kinda of odd, chewy texture.
I wouldn't be too encouraged to get any of the other chicken dishes from this, especially since I didn't find the menu to be very descriptive.
But, I might give the beef dishes a try based on other reviews.
pepian.author: Lisa K.
pepian.review: I guess I ordered the wrong things here. First, the good: the tortillas were great, the horchata was pretty tasty, I liked the black beans, and the service was excellent. I got the vegetarian plate, which was mainly just bland, from the baked plantain to the rice to the plain, boiled vegetables. I wouldn't get it again. The pepian chicken had a tasty sauce but the chicken seemed to be full of gristle and odds and ends, and had a kinda of odd, chewy texture. I wouldn't be too encouraged to get any of the other chicken dishes from this, especially since I didn't find the menu to be very descriptive. But, I might give the beef dishes a try based on other reviews.

excerpts: Had tamales, pepian, chiles rellenos, carne asada and churrasco chapin on several occasions.
It's good depending on who's in the kitchen - good when parents are cooking and bad when kids are cooking.
I won't be going back, the last straw was the soggy cream of wheat like tamales.
pepian.author: Elsie D.
pepian.review: Had tamales, pepian, chiles rellenos, carne asada and churrasco chapin on several occasions.  It's good depending on who's in the kitchen - good when parents are cooking and bad when kids are cooking. I won't be going back, the last straw was the soggy cream of wheat like tamales.

excerpts:
- Prawns in garlic sauce

Plato de San Miguel ($13.95) - Thin New York steak, sausage, fried plantain and fresh cheese

Pollo Frito ($11.95) - Fried Chicken

Entrees are served with rice, black beans, beet salad, and tortillas.
pollo frito.author: Zoran L.
pollo frito.review:
Chilitos Rellenos ($4.95) - Three small peppers stuffed with meat and covered with sauce.

Tamales de Carne de Pollo ($3.95) - Tamale with chicken, olives, red bell peppers, prunes with special sauce inside all wrapped in banana leaves

Camarones al Mojo De Ajo ($12.95) - Prawns in garlic sauce

Plato de San Miguel ($13.95) - Thin New York steak, sausage, fried plantain and fresh cheese

Pollo Frito ($11.95) - Fried Chicken

Entrees are served with rice, black beans, beet salad, and tortillas.

Overall the food was delicious.  As a family we shared everything, and our daughter happily devoured the tamale and fried chicken.  

Great family run restaurant. Service was fast and very friendly. 

The only thing that didn't go over well was the Horchata.  Our 4 year old loves them (for the usual high sugar content), haha.  This one wasn't very sweet, so depends on your tastebuds.

We look forward to coming back and trying other Guatemalan dishes.

They are currently CASH ONLY with plans to accept credit cards in the coming weeks.

excerpts:
Ordered the Plato San Miguel. 
It was amazing! 
It's the closest I've found in the Bay Area to home Central American home cooking!
Highlights:
The plantains were the perfect amount of caramelized & crispy on the edges, but soft on the inside. 
The combo of queso & frijoles was perfect.
plato san miguel.author: Sam J.
plato san miguel.review:
Ordered the Plato San Miguel. It was amazing! It's the closest I've found in the Bay Area to home Central American home cooking!
Highlights:
The plantains were the perfect amount of caramelized & crispy on the edges, but soft on the inside. 
The combo of queso & frijoles was perfect. 
Great asada too!

I also ordered the tamarind, which was also amazing

The service was great & really friendly!

excerpts: We ordered the Plato San Miguel very good!
plato san miguel.author: Brett I.
plato san miguel.review:
Such an amazing restaurant! We stumbled in here on a whim and it turned into one of our favorites. The owners are extremely friendly! 
We ordered the Plato San Miguel very good!

excerpts: We tried the tamales and Plato San Miguel, both were great.
plato san miguel.author: Trace B.
plato san miguel.review: This restaurant is a serious hidden gem. The food is amazing and the flavors are really unique. Had a great experience with the staff and owners. We will definitely be back. I didn't know I was such a fan of home style Guatemalan cooking until going here! We tried the tamales and Plato San Miguel, both were great.

excerpts: We ordered plato san miguel which is number 30.
I highly recommend this plate because it wasnt overwhelming and still filled me up.
plato san miguel.author: Annie D.
plato san miguel.review:
Came to this place at around noon hoping for a great experience and i did! I loved it! The smell of the restaurant was like the smell from home. It didn't smell like grease like other restaurants. 
I was confused when i walked in because i wasn't sure whether to wait to be seated or just pick a spot. 

Anyway, the lady who served my table (1 other person with me) was very nice. She did everything, took our order, drinks, and bussed our table. 

We ordered tostadas which were delicious. 6 total, 2 guacamole, 2 beans, 2 salsa topped with onions and spicy salsa on the side. 

We ordered plato san miguel which is number 30. I highly recommend this plate because it wasnt overwhelming and still filled me up. 
Ordered horchata and famosa beer. 

Everything was nice and clean. Definitely coming back~

excerpts: Plato San Miguel is the one I always get.
I have been coming here for at least 15 years.
Yes, I drive the 50 minutes it takes to get there as often as I can.
If I could eat this food on a daily basis I would.
plato san miguel.author: Vivian A.
plato san miguel.review: I love love love LOVE this place. Plato San Miguel is the one I always get. I have been coming here for at least 15 years. Yes, I drive the 50 minutes it takes to get there as often as I can. If I could eat this food on a daily basis I would.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the longanizas (spicy sausage) as well as the steak in the Plato San Miguel.
The platanos were perfectly cooked and you'd be a fool not to try the habanero salsa.
plato san miguel.author: vanessa J.
plato san miguel.review:
Wow. I'm coming back here as soon as possible. I could not stop eating my food and now I'm in a food coma. Forgive my lack of eloquence. 
I really enjoyed the longanizas (spicy sausage) as well as the steak in the Plato San Miguel. The platanos were perfectly cooked and you'd be a fool not to try the habanero salsa. Wash it down with their house-made cinnamonny horchata goodness. Yum.

excerpts: I had the plato san miguel and taquitos and tostada sides, brought me back to the old days!
plato san miguel.author: R. V.
plato san miguel.review:
Awesome Guatemalan food. At last I found what I was looking for, and they did not disappoint. Service was the best, extremely friendly staff, made us feel like we were at a friend's house eating a homemade meal :)

I had the plato san miguel and taquitos and tostada sides, brought me back to the old days! couldn't be more satisfied.

Can't wait to come back to try their breakfast!

excerpts:
+ Plato San Miguel
+ Carne Encebollada
+ Horchata

Other than what I listed above, you have to try the Camarones al Mojo de Ajo (Shrimp w/ garlic butter sauce).
plato san miguel.author: Vincent B.
plato san miguel.review:
+ Plato San Miguel
+ Carne Encebollada
+ Horchata

Other than what I listed above, you have to try the Camarones al Mojo de Ajo (Shrimp w/ garlic butter sauce). Better yet ... try everything on the menu. 

Parking can be a bitch around here, but so is anywhere else in SF.

excerpts: For my entree I had, Churrasco Chapin (Charbroiled New Your Steak, with chimichurri sauce, and chirmol)
churrasco chapin.author: Yvette K.
churrasco chapin.review:
A solid 3 stars for San Miguel (would give 3.5). I live around the corner from San Miguel Restaurant and came here the other night for the first time - I wish I had come here long before now, since I've lived in Bernal Heights for over 15 years. Needless to say, I will be back. 

The waiter was very friendly and the food was great. I have deducted 2 stars because the food is VERY good, but it's not fantastic (I didn't love what my friend had). The prices are very reasonable.

We had a very tasty appetizer called, Chilitos Rellenos (Small bell peppers, stuffed with choped meat, sauce on top) $4.25. 

For my entree I had, Churrasco Chapin (Charbroiled New Your Steak, with chimichurri sauce, and chirmol) $11.95. It was delicious and would order it again. 

My friend had, Carne Encebollada (Beef steak and mushrooms sautaed, with tomatoes, onions) $9.95. I thought it was just OK and I bet he would order something else next time.

They had good and fresh spicy salsa too.

I would recommend San Miguel Restaurant if you're in Bernal Heights. This isn't a destination restaurant, but is a great neighborhood find. Yay, Bernal Heights!

excerpts: Had tamales, pepian, chiles rellenos, carne asada and churrasco chapin on several occasions.
It's good depending on who's in the kitchen - good when parents are cooking and bad when kids are cooking.
I won't be going back, the last straw was the soggy cream of wheat like tamales.
churrasco chapin.author: Elsie D.
churrasco chapin.review: Had tamales, pepian, chiles rellenos, carne asada and churrasco chapin on several occasions.  It's good depending on who's in the kitchen - good when parents are cooking and bad when kids are cooking. I won't be going back, the last straw was the soggy cream of wheat like tamales.

excerpts: This is my first time coming to this restaurant, I ordered #37: longanizas.
The pork sausages were tasty and delicious.
Inside was very juicy and tender.
It reminds me of my home country longaniza taste.
Definitely recommended!
longanizas.author: Mila N.
longanizas.review: This is my first time coming to this restaurant, I ordered #37: longanizas. The pork sausages were tasty and delicious. Inside was very juicy and tender. It reminds me of my home country longaniza taste. Definitely recommended!

excerpts: I really enjoyed the longanizas (spicy sausage) as well as the steak in the Plato San Miguel.
The platanos were perfectly cooked and you'd be a fool not to try the habanero salsa.
longanizas.author: vanessa J.
longanizas.review:
Wow. I'm coming back here as soon as possible. I could not stop eating my food and now I'm in a food coma. Forgive my lack of eloquence. 
I really enjoyed the longanizas (spicy sausage) as well as the steak in the Plato San Miguel. The platanos were perfectly cooked and you'd be a fool not to try the habanero salsa. Wash it down with their house-made cinnamonny horchata goodness. Yum.

excerpts: Over time, however, I've been disappointed perhaps because I compare what I order with my mom's or Abuelita's dishes, or just because I no longer enjoy what I order because things are always too salty: the beans, the sauces, the mole, longanizas, etc.
Today, unfortunately, was not any different although I was hopeful.
I ordered the soap de gallina criolla (hen soup) and barely touched it because it was too salty!
The same thing goes for the soap de pata, which my husband order; and even after adding hot water to our soup bowls to cut the salt we couldn't make any progress on it.
I seriously doubt that we will return based on this experience.
Bummer!
longanizas.author: Maria E.
longanizas.review: When San Miguel first opened I was a happy camper!  I looked forward to eating the food from my homeland and was impressed. Over time, however, I've been disappointed perhaps because I compare what I order with my mom's or Abuelita's dishes, or just because I no longer enjoy what I order because things are always too salty: the beans, the sauces, the mole, longanizas, etc. Today, unfortunately, was not any different although I was hopeful.  I ordered the soap de gallina criolla (hen soup) and barely touched it because it was too salty!  The same thing goes for the soap de pata, which my husband order; and even after adding hot water to our soup bowls to cut the salt we couldn't make any progress on it.  I seriously doubt that we will return based on this experience. Bummer!

excerpts: The Longanizas are extremely tasty, the Chuchitos were perfect, the Pollo Adobado was awesome and the $10 Ceviche was NEVERENDING!
You definitely get your money's worth here, and on top of that, it's just undeniably delicious.
longanizas.author: Jonathan B.
longanizas.review:
I hadn't had authentic Guatemalan food in 6 years, since I lived there for 2 years.  I seriously craved it and I wasn't able to satisfy that craving until this afternoon.

I was afraid it was going to suck just like most restaurants do in Guat itself, but the food was AMAZING!!!  Just like specialty homecooked meals with an extremely friendly staff and fun atmosphere.

The Longanizas are extremely tasty, the Chuchitos were perfect, the Pollo Adobado was awesome and the $10 Ceviche was NEVERENDING!  You definitely get your money's worth here, and on top of that, it's just undeniably delicious.

excerpts: We ordered two Plato De San Miguel they were both so so so so good, could def use a little more rice but other then that absolutely no complaints with this plate.
I also ordered a order of Rellenitos
good god
I haven't had one these since the days I used to ride the buses in guatemala with my grandmother and the ladies
would come on the bus and sell these.
rice.author: Katherine J.
rice.review:
I just wanna say I was born in Guatemala and this was one of the best Authentic Guatemalan restaurants I have been to. We were the first to walk in here on sunday morning July, 30 the girl that greeted us/our server was very nice. 

      We ordered two Plato De San Miguel they were both so so so so good, could def use a little more rice but other then that absolutely no complaints with this plate. I also ordered a order of Rellenitos good god I haven't had one these since the days I used to ride the buses in guatemala with my grandmother and the ladies would come on the bus and sell these. Absolutely amazing!!

     I also ordered a Guatemalan coffee which wasn't very good and I didnt say anything but she def noticed I didn't like it so she told me she wouldn't charge me for it. 

     Over all what a great little place, also after we walked in people started pouring in this place looks very popular!

excerpts: Served with super velvety black beans, deliciously rice, and tortillas.
So freaking good!
rice.author: Wayne S.
rice.review: Whoo this place is the bomb.com! So good. I'm a huge Latin cuisine fan but have never had Guatemalan food before. I assumed it was similar to Mexican or Salvadorian but man was I in for a surprise. I was able to speak to the Chef Juliano, super nice guy, and he mentioned they used to have a food truck and had been on Food Network. After that, I was like tell me what to eat and I'll eat it, his recommendation was Adobvada, which is made with pork shoulder. I was a little hesitant because I'm not into pork but oh boy am I glad I got that. The exterior of this dish is super crunchy giving it an incredible texture, almost like really good fried chicken. Served with super velvety black beans, deliciously rice, and tortillas. So freaking good!

excerpts: The rice is really good and the black beans just hit the spot.
Then we got some platanos with beans and crema and it was delicious.
Also ordered a banana milkshake and it tasted just like home.
I was in heaven and would go back once a week if I could.
Cash only!
rice.author: Alexis G.
rice.review:
One of the best things I've found in SF! It was a little piece of home.
Delicious, authentic Guatemalan food.
Ordered hilachas which was super delicious. The rice is really good and the black beans just hit the spot.
Then we got some platanos with beans and crema and it was delicious. Also ordered a banana milkshake and it tasted just like home. I was in heaven and would go back once a week if I could.
Cash only!

excerpts: we spilt a plate with beef, a house-made sausage, rice, plantains, a small wedge of cojita, a log of beans that actually looked EXACTLY like a big dog poop (
sorry but its true, once i said it, neither if us could look at it, let alone eat it AND some spaghetti thing on top
(HUH? spaghetti??).
rice.author: Amy W.
rice.review:
This place - I wanted to love it - service was great - but it was just weird.

We ordered a LARGE beer and it came in a bamboo glass - which might have been kinda cool - but the glass smelled funny and I'm not so certain you can clean bamboo like you can glass so it kinda grossed me out.

We ordered the taquitos - which were the best thing we ordered.  we also got a stuffed pepper appetizer which was fair.  Then we ordered 2 tamales which my bf thought were okay I thought they were gross, kinda slimy masa and flavorless to boot.  

Entree we spilt a plate with beef, a house-made sausage, rice, plantains, a small wedge of cojita, a log of beans that actually looked EXACTLY like a big dog poop (sorry but its true, once i said it, neither if us could look at it, let alone eat it AND some spaghetti thing on top (HUH? spaghetti??).  Served with some small not-homemade corn tortillas.

Sorry, this place just missed the mark for me, I guess I can see how people could like it, I just didn't.

Oh we had a Scoutmob and paid $40 with tip (which included a $15 discount)

excerpts: I went with the garlic shrimp, which was served with black bean, rice, tortillas, and a small salad.
Everything was very tasty, and felt very comforting/home-style.
rice.author: Sarah F.
rice.review:
First off, the man who works here (owner?) is just plain awesome.  Welcoming, kind, jolly...  We were seated right away on a Friday night around 8.  I didn't know what to order, as I've not eaten much Guatemalan food; so I asked the waiter/owner/gentleman for his recommendation.  I went with the garlic shrimp, which was served with black bean, rice, tortillas, and a small salad.  Everything was very tasty, and felt very comforting/home-style.  The salsa is pretty spicy, just  warning.  

This place isn't chi-chi or chic, just a no-frills place for some yummy authentic Guatemalan food.  Cash only.

excerpts: I personally love the New York steak (great flavors and served with beans, rice, and pasta), the seafood soup, the taquitos, and the shrimp appetizer (tostaditos de cerviche).
All these dishes are very fresh.
My husband
rice.author: L L.
rice.review:
This is a great little place if you are looking for some authentic Guatemalan food.  I think you have to know what dishes to pick, though.  I personally love the New York steak (great flavors and served with beans, rice, and pasta), the seafood soup, the taquitos, and the shrimp appetizer (tostaditos de cerviche).  All these dishes are very fresh.  My husband and I end up ordering these pretty much every time.  

Because of the quality of food and authentic flavors, I will give this place 5 stars.  The downside is that it's cash only, which can be quite a pain for dinner.

excerpts: Rice and homemade corn tortillas were served on the side.
L ordered the chicken in mole which was served with rice, beans, and beets.
He was very pleased with the dish.
rice.author: Rob L.
rice.review:
AN OASIS IN THE MISSION DISTRICT SERVING AUTHENTIC GUATAMALAN FOOD

We opened the sliding door and entered this cozy and cute restaurant on a cold and rainy evening.  Plants and wooden carvings hanging from the tin-roof ceiling add atmosphere to the dining room.  The friendly server came over to greet us and took our order in Spanish.  She brought us sliced pineapple and watermelon to begin the meal.

Chicken Pepian
Boneless pieces of chicken were immersed in an intoxicating earthy broth made from chilies, tomatillos, and seeds.  Rice and homemade corn tortillas were served on the side.  This dish exceeded my expectations!

Chicken Mole
L ordered the chicken in mole which was served with rice, beans, and beets.  He was very pleased with the dish.  I tasted the mole and it was on the sweet side but tasted very good.

The salsa served on the side is spicy and flavorful.  We were very pleased with the attentive service; it was like having a homemade meal.

excerpts: I had some combination plate that came with a steak, sausage, beans, rice, salad and plantains.
Man for a moment
I flashed back to when i was a lil' kid getting ready for dinner when I used to live with my grandma.
The food was so flavorful but no overwhelming.
the steak was juicy and tender which made me eat as slowly as possible savoring every bite.
rice.author: Alfredo N.
rice.review:
I'm part Guatemalan and had the pleasure to have grown up eating dishes that both my Mom and Grandma cooked.

Guatemalans are not huge in numbers here as Mexicans so it isn't as easy to come across a place that knows how to make tasty good quality food. I was riding shotgun one late night down mission and I caught a glimpse of the little sign (Before they hung up the banner) and said i wanted to come back and try. for weeks later I tried to find this place but for the life of me could not. then as usual as it most of the time is me and the GF stumbled upon it as we were looking for parking to go to some other spot. So we had to try it.

I had some combination plate that came with a steak, sausage, beans, rice, salad and plantains. Man for a moment I flashed back to when i was a lil' kid getting ready for dinner when I used to live with my grandma. The food was so flavorful but no overwhelming. the steak was juicy and tender which made me eat as slowly as possible savoring every bite. the sausage was also great but for the size and price i wish they would have thrown another one in. 

I enjoyed the decor as it had all these pictures and curiosities from Guatemala. I'm glad I was able to finally try this place. Here is where I will return when i miss being a kid and getting home cooked meals.

excerpts: Also the whole plate was sort of a mess I thought because the chicken mole was served with black beans rice and queso.
rice.author: Jose U.
rice.review:
I'm from Guatemala and grew up with my mom making stuff like Pepian, rabo (oxtail), tamales, sopa de res, hilachas etc. So I really want to like this place. The service is good, very attentive. But the food can be hit or miss. The first time I came here, I came with a friend and we tried the ceviche. It tasted nice and fresh, it was pretty good. Also had the Pepian, the sauce for it was good but I was disappointed that they made it with chicken.
The second time I came it was with my parents. They ordered the sopa de res and were pretty happy with it and they have discerning taste for that sort of thing. I decided to try the mole and it wasn't very good I'm sorry to report. I'm not sure if mole is supposed to be so chocolaty...the chicken was sort of bland and chewy. Also the whole plate was sort of a mess I thought because the chicken mole was served with black beans rice and queso. It was just all over the place in terms of flavors.

 My dad ordered platanos en mole and there the chocolaty sauce complemented the plantains very well.

I would definitely recommend the Pepian, and will try the sopa de res. Unfortunately they don't make rabo :(

The place looks clean, but it's kind of small and to add to the ambiance they play marimba music and videos of Guatemalan music. The place is definitely not good for large groups or even medium ones, four people per group tops. Parking is tough in the neighborhood and it's CASH ONLY :(

I wouldn't get it again.

I got the vegetarian plate, which was mainly just bland, from the baked plantain to the rice to the plain, boiled vegetables. I wouldn't get it again. The pepian chicken had a tasty sauce but the chicken seemed to be full of gristle and odds and ends, and had a kinda of odd, chewy texture. I wouldn't be too encouraged to get any of the other chicken dishes from this, especially since I didn't find the menu to be very descriptive. But, I might give the beef dishes a try based on other reviews.

excerpts: It's basically a cold beef salad with orange juice, mint, onions, cilantro and onions and  served with soft and crunchy tortillas, rice and beans.
It was perfect with the HOT salsa.
We also tried the chilitos rellenos and plantanos.
everything was great!
rice.author: Erick A.
rice.review: I walked by this place, scanned the menu and found something that sounded perfect for this hot day in the city... Salpicon Beef.  mmmm.  It's basically a cold beef salad with orange juice, mint, onions, cilantro and onions and  served with soft and crunchy tortillas, rice and beans.  It was perfect with the HOT salsa.  We also tried the chilitos rellenos and plantanos.  everything was great!

excerpts: san miguel plate is really good, it comes with a tasty steak, beans, rice, and plantains.
I pretty much like everything.
rice.author: perla P.
rice.review: The best Guatemalan food I have eaten in the bay so far. I love this place, their decoration and customer service is great. For apetizer I like tostaditas ( I think that's the name) san miguel plate is really good, it comes with a tasty steak, beans, rice, and plantains. I pretty much like everything.

excerpts: for starters, get the beans+cheese dish and the "avocado deep" guacamole (don't ask, know idea, but i'm sure it will be the deepest avocado you've ever had)
avocado.author: James R.
avocado.review:
+
* really good, totally authentic food - the guatemalan chorizo (forget the name) was very good, and the fried pork was even better.  for starters, get the beans+cheese dish and the "avocado deep" guacamole (don't ask, know idea, but i'm sure it will be the deepest avocado you've ever had) 

* fun atmosphere - big, crowded tables, lots of plants, playing guatamalan pop music on flat screen tvs (usually tvs a bad sign in a restaurant, but worked here)

* awesome staff - some of the nicest, most enthusiastic i've had in in a long time

-
hot as hell in there - need more ventilation.
